events.name: Installed Kubernetes, now what?
events.description:
Find out what is behind the Kubernetes hype and go beyond a typical ‚Äúhello world‚Äù installation. If you‚Äôre familiar with Docker and Linux and want to learn how to quickly install a functional Kubernetes cluster then join us for a fun group technical session on how to build a cluster to run your applications in the real world.

In two hours we‚Äôll cover how to:
- install a local cluster
- expose services
- add persistent storage
- secure the cluster
- and finally, package and deploy your real world apps using Helm

The workshop will be conducted by the team of the seasoned DevOps engineers with experience in building data security product. We will quickly demonstrate each of these topics and spend time drilling down into the fine details in an interactive, hands-on workshop.

=====================================
Important (!) :
- bring your own laptop
- we have limited number of places, to guarantee your participation buy a ticket here https://2event.com/uk/events/1413903
=====================================

Very Good Security is a modern approach to data security. Our SaaS solution gives our customers all the benefits of interacting with sensitive and regulated data without the liability of securing it. We like to think of it as ‚ÄúSecurity and Compliance for Developers.‚Äù

www.verygoodsecurity.com

events.name: Platform and Automation in Kiwi.com
events.description:
Passionate about technologies and traveling? Let's dive behind the scenes and explore the technical side of one of the biggest travel agencies!
On May 30 we'll host a meetup with Kiwi.com engineers about Platform and Automation stack.

Kiwi.com is an online travel agency that provides users with the cheapest flight itineraries and combinations.
Today, the company sees more than 90 million flight searches every day and employs over 2400 people worldwide.

Our speakers will share experience and problems they are facing during GCP migration, decisions, and challenges that stay behind the migration to GKE, their solution of migration automation.
Also, they will talk about how the CI/CD pipelines are organized in Kiwi to keep reliable and fast development process across the teams.

Agenda
19:00 ‚Äì 19:15 ‚Äì Registration
19:15 ‚Äì 19:30 ‚Äì Intro
19:30 ‚Äì 20:20 ‚Äì GCP Migration in Kiwi
20:20 ‚Äì 20:30 ‚Äì Coffee break
20:30 ‚Äì 21:00 ‚Äì Streamline your CI
21:00 ‚Äì 22:00 ‚Äì Networking

All talks will be in English.

1. GCP Migration in Kiwi
(Yurii Kyrychynskyi , Platform Engineer @Kiwi.com)
The talk will be about Kiwi.com infrastructure and developers experience. Were are we today and how our tech stack looks like? We decided to migrate most of our workloads from AWS to GKE and we will talk about our reasons. How are we preparing for this migration - from planning to tooling. How Terraform and Cookiecutters helped us in simplifying team and service on-boarding.

2. Streamline your CI
(Alex Viscreanu Full stack developer @Kiwi.com)
CI/CD is one of the main pillars of agile development. CI pipelines should be robust, and not allow deploying broken code to production, but also fast, so developers can get feedback as soon as possible and decrease the time necessary to do an emergency deployment. In this talk I'll explain some of the most common pitfalls regarding CI pipelines and how we solved them at Kiwi.com.

Participation is free upon registration!

Thanks to Kiwi.com (https://www.kiwi.com/) and Lohika (https://www.lohika.com/) for their help in organizing the event!

events.name: Docker: Modern Problems Require Modern Solutions
Online Speedrun Challenge: BigQuery, Kubernetes, ML and Cloud Run
events.description:
Hello!

We‚Äôre sure most of you have learning new technologies and tools as New Year‚Äôs resolutions. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre excited to participate in the the first Community Speedrun Challenge that Google is organizing for developer communities in Europe. And as part of the GDG Cloud Lviv, you‚Äôre among the first to know about this!!

The Community Speedrun Challenge is a training program that will run in February where you‚Äôll have the opportunity to join four Speedruns and get hands-on experience with tools like Kubernetes, Assistant, BigQuery our Cloud Run, Every Speedrun is open for a week to give you the ability to finish all labs in your best time, scoring more points and winning prizes.

Find more information and register here: https://bit.ly/speedrunchallenge0220

Schedule:
Speedrun Start Dates: February 3, 10, 17 and 24
Webinar Time: Mondays from 7pm to 9pm (GMT+1)

Topics
BigQuery Basics for Data Analysts https://google.qwiklabs.com/quests/69
Kubernetes in the Google Cloud https://www.qwiklabs.com/quests/29
Google Developer Essentials https://www.qwiklabs.com/quests/86?catalog_rank=%7B%22rank%22%3A1%2C%22num_filters%22%3A0%2C%22has_search%22%3Atrue%7D&search_id=4296761
Hello Cloud Run https://google.qwiklabs.com/focuses/5162?catalog_rank=%7B%22rank%22%3A1%2C%22num_filters%22%3A0%2C%22has_search%22%3Atrue%7D&parent=catalog&search_id=3527997
